concept.title: Warnings and Precautions for Cleaning Materials
concept.shortdesc: Cleaning materials and solvents may have adverse effects on typewriter materials. It is important to test cleaning agents and tools before applying them to a typewriter.

ul.li: Warning: If bubbling, discoloration, or paint stripping occurs, the cleaner should be removed from the panel immediately, and a gentler cleaning solution should be tested on a small area.
Warning: Contact with decals, branding components, or model names should be avoided, as even mild soap and water can remove painted details.

Warning: Mineral spirits should not come into contact with any rubber or soft-plastic components of the typewriter, including the platen, feeder, and paper bail rollers, as prolonged exposure will degrade the rubber over time.

conbody.note: If key caps, knobs, or other high-touch surfaces have tar buildup indicated by severe yellowing, they may be soaked in a 3% hydrogen peroxide solution for 4 to 8 hours to remove discoloration.
If the typewriter has steel or aluminum panels, car wax may be applied according to the product directions to create a glossy finish and prevent rusting.
